required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prescribing Practice of Medication - Patient View.
clinical_study.official_title: Prescribing Practice of Medicinal Products From the Perspective of the Patient.

brief_summary.textblock:
In the clinical routine of a hospital, there are often problems dealing with medication that has already been prescribed at the time of admission due to incomplete or missing medication lists from the family doctor. Often patients forget this list at home.
This pilot study focuses on the medication process from admission to discharge and patient health literacy.

primary_outcome.measure: Health competence of patients with focus on drugs.
primary_outcome.description: Correct knowledge of the medication (indication) - assessed by Interview with the patient

primary_outcome.measure: Drug prescription from the view of the patient- Amount
primary_outcome.description: Amount of prescribed drugs by descriptive chart review with CRF (Case Report Form) and interview with the patient

primary_outcome.measure: Drug prescription from the view of the patient- Type of drugs
primary_outcome.description: Type of prescribed drugs by descriptive chart review with CRF and interview with the patient

primary_outcome.measure: Drug prescription from the view of the patient- Discrepancies
primary_outcome.description: Potential discrepancies between amount or type of drugs indicated by the patient and descriptive chart review with CRF

study_pop.textblock: 100 patients in the primary care clinic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient hospitalised at the clinical ward of Endocrinilogy and Diabetology and plastic Surgery
- Patient with an minimum of 2 days hospitalisation
- good knowledge of German
- Age 18 to 99 Years
- Male/female
Exclusion Criteria:
- Neurological or psychiatric primary disease e.g. Dementia
- Rehospitalisation 7 days after discharge from hospital
- Patients who need intensive care
